lead_paragraph: While the Rangers’ biggest need may be pitching, the team’s biggest assets are its still-developing hitters. With the promotion of Chris Davis, below, from the Oklahoma Redhawks, Texas may have another masher to add to its lineup. A 22-year-old first baseman, Davis hit 23 homers this season between Class AA and Class AAA, with 10 coming in only 111 at-bats at the higher level. His 73 strikeouts in 297 at-bats were high, but his on-base plus slugging percentage was over 1.000 against both lefties and righties. He homered Friday, in the Rangers’ hitter-friendly park, in his first major league start.
